attributes.action: Insulate the homes of old age pensioners.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Due to rocketing fuel prices the winter of 2008 will see great hardship amongst OAPs. It’s quite likely cold weather will result in many deaths. To date the answer has been to give OAPs ‘fuel money’ – but this is, never enough and just increases CO2 emissions. What is needed is insulation, which pays back now – and for evermore.

A practical low-cost solution, is to create a ‘WARM POD’ – say 8’ x 10’ – within old people’s houses. Constructed with fire-resistant rigid foam and foil (or similar), 6” thick, prefabricated and erected in just it couple of hours, it would be heated with no more than a light bulb, TV and body heat. It will be warm as toast. There would need to be a small heat recovery unit (HRV) at the top to ventilate it and a window in one side that could be aligned with the window in the host room. Even if the person needed to come out to make tea it would provide a warm refuge. Put a bed in there and you have a ‘WARM-POD’ that would cost a fraction of other solutions.  Not perfect – but needs must. A life-saver.
